Communicate your decisions using the following action protocols:
  '[Check]'  - when no wager is pending
  '[Call]'   - equal the existing bet
  '[Fold]'   - abandon your current hand
  '[Bet N]'  - place an opening bet of N chips
  '[Raise N]'- escalate the betting by N chips

Invalid actions will result in retries. Use exact bracket format and ensure you have sufficient chips for bets/raises. Check when facing a bet is invalid.
[GAME] Starting a new 10-round Texas Hold'em game with 2 players.
[GAME] ===== Hand 1 / 10 - Pre‑flop =====
Pot: 30 | Current bet: 20
Visible board: []
P0 (Dealer/BB): 990.00 chips | bet 10.00 | active
P1 (SB): 980.00 chips | bet 20.00 | active
Your hole: 8♥, Q♠
==============================================
rounds.response:
I hold Q♠-8♥ in the big blind.  
Strength: unsuited, off-suit, middle-gap (Q-high) – barely ahead of a pure steal range, behind most solid holdings. I'm closing the pre-flop action versus P1’s 20-chip raise (another 10 for me to see the flop).

Pot is currently 30 chips, cost-to-call is 10.

If I fold I forfeit 10 and save 990.

If I call I pay 10 more (990 → 980) and start a 50-chip pot with a hand that plays decently post-flop only if I spike a Q; otherwise I’m often trailing versus whatever he open-raises with.

Neutral EV check/call line vs tight opponent favors fold, but Deviation is high.

Value here is marginal at best. Given that we will face 9 more hands and stack depth is large, I’ll take the conservative route to preserve channel capital.

[Fold]
